subject: Economics
title: James Buchanan: Public Choice Theory
description: A short lesson to help you apply James Buchanan: Public Choice Theory.

hook.text: Why do governments waste money? Buchanan's answer: because politicians are self-interested, just like everyone else.

buildup.text: Traditional economics assumed government actors are benevolent.

discovery.text: Public choice theory: politicians maximize votes, bureaucrats maximize budgets.

twist.text: A $10 million subsidy benefits one company intensely. It costs each taxpayer 3 cents.

climax.text: Buchanan showed that 'government failure' is as real as market failure.

punchline.text: Governments fail for the same reason markets do.

quiz.question: What is the core insight of public choice theory?
